intro: Spermacoce erioclada var. linearifolia, commonly known as the slender spurge or linear-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically followed by spherical, fleshy fruits. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in open woodlands and disturbed soils. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
